name: mm-autocomplete
description: A fully-styled dropdown list containing multiple options.

attributes.name: search
attributes.description: Sets the visual state of the input, adding a search icon. mm-autocomplete is searchable by default.

attributes.name: clear
attributes.description: Sets the visual state of the input when content has been entered, adding a clear icon. mm-autocomplete is clear enabled by default.

attributes.name: overflow
attributes.description: Instructs the dropdown panel, which contains the search results, to truncate or show the full text of each result. Longer text will be truncated by default, unless this attribute (or property) is set to 'visible'.

attributes.name: overflowWidth
attributes.description: Instructs the dropdown panel to clamp it's width at the specified number. Useful when an overflow is desired, but horizontal page real estate is limited.

attributes.name: direction
attributes.description: Instructs the dropdown panel, which contains the search results, to to display above or below the text input field. By default, the dropdown panel will dosplay below the input. Options correspont to a compass paradigme i.e. - 'north' ('n') or 'south' ('s').

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Sets the visual and interaction state to be disabled.

attributes.name: error
attributes.description: Sets the visual state of the input field to have a red outline, denoting an error state.

attributes.name: fitparent
attributes.description: Sets the width of the component to fill the width of it's parent element.

attributes.name: placeholder
attributes.description: The placeholder text displayed in the input prior to user interaction.

attributes.name: maxItems
attributes.description: Limits the number of list items displayed in the dropdown panel, allowing the list to scroll vertically if necessary.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The value of the input, or the value of the selected item from the dropdown panel. Items which appear in the dropdown panel list can be configured as desired (see 'data' for more information).

attributes.name: data
attributes.description: The data which populates the dropdown panel list, expressed as an array of objects with key value pairs i.e. - [ { name: 'name', value: 'value' }, {...} ].

attributes.name: state
attributes.description: Sets the visual state of the element.

attributes.name: isClosed
attributes.description: Returns a boolean corresponding to the visual state of the element.

attributes.name: selectedIndex
attributes.description: An integer representing the index of the selected list item from the dropdown panel. As the list items will be filtered upon user interaction - the number returned will correspond with the index of the item in original data set (see 'data' for more information).

attributes.name: items
attributes.description: Returns only the filtered search data used to populate the element. Only available after a value has been applied.

attributes.name: domItems
attributes.description: Returns an array of mm-list-items which populate the dropdown panel. Only available after a value has been applied.

attributes.name: itemHeight
attributes.description: Returns the offsetHeight of a single mm-list-item used to populate the dropdown panel.

arguments.name: silent
arguments.description: Used to allow or suppress the firing of an 'open' event (see 'events' for more information).

arguments.name: silent
arguments.description: Used to allow or suppress the firing of a 'close' event (see 'events' for more information).

methods.name: reset
methods.description: Resets the component to it's default display state, and clears any value.

methods.name: toggle
methods.description: Toggles the visual state of the component between 'opened' and 'closed'.

arguments.name: silent
arguments.description: Used to allow or suppress the firing of an 'open' or 'close' event, depending on the component's current state (see 'events' for more information).

detail.name: value
detail.description: The value of the selected mm-list-item. If no value was supplied, it will return the text content of the list item.

detail.name: item
detail.description: The data object which was selected.

detail.name: index
detail.description: The index of data object which was selected.

detail.name: value
detail.description: The value property of data object which was selected.

detail.name: name
detail.description: The name property of data object which was selected.

detail.name: selected
detail.description: TODO: data obj doesn't actually have a selected property.
